subject: p18615099
Findings: Patient is status post median sternotomy and CABG. Left-sided pacemaker device is noted with leads terminating in the right atrium and right ventricle, unchanged. The heart remains mildly enlarged but stable. The aorta is unfolded. There is mild pulmonary vascular congestion, which is improved when compared to the prior exam. No new focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax is present. There are mild degenerative changes in the thoracic spine.
Impression: Mild pulmonary vascular congestion, improved when compared to the prior exam.
